data.meta_description: Very sad - JMIR Publications is now pretty much the last small/medium sized full independent OA publisher left standing. I wonder if it dawns on Coalition S‚Ä¶
data.text:
Joey Barton, a former professional footballer and manager, grew up as a young boy on the streets of Huyton, Merseyside. A boy with a childhood dream, he went on to make 269 appearances in the Premier League, including Manchester City. Barton‚Äôs career however, was fraught with controversy, involving gambling and assaults. Huyton, where Barton was born and raised, became well known in 2005, due to the racially motivated murder of Anthony Walker. It was for issues like this, that Barton had such a dream; something to get him away from trouble. You see, the two offenders were young, 17 and 20 years old, with the 17 year old, Michael Barton; Joeys younger brother. Like him or loathe him, Joey Barton wanted better for his life, and whilst he managed to succeed in becoming a footballer, he never managed to get away from his roots of Huyton and embedded violent tendencies. Joey Barton needed positivity from those around him, support when things were going against him and someone in his corner to cheerlead him unconditionally. We need to change the narrative and celebrate successes, dreams and aspirations, instead of ridiculing those who express desires and whom dare to be different. We must consciously be the role model others need us to be, so we can actively influence a culture of positivity, dreams, visions and safety. #evolvingmanproject #author #jayroberts #alphamale #family #positivethinking #choice #ownership #priorities #effort #ego #culture #empowerment #inspire #emotionalintelligence #culturalarchitect #keynotespeaker #confidence #diaryofaninnerlion #empathy #values #gentleman #manifest #trusttheprocess #rolemodel

This is how you can call yourself and others a "Team". Willingness to serve. Yes, you heard that right - to serve. It may seem counterintuitive, but it has the power to transform organizations. I thought that my role was to make all the decisions and be the one in control. But as I started to truly listen to others and value their input, I saw a shift in the dynamics. By incorporating their ideas and suggestions into the plans, the goals were achievable faster and with more enthusiasm. The overall efficiency of the organization improved. But being an effective leader goes beyond just listening to others. It also involves regulating our own emotions. We are all human, and emotions can sometimes get the best of us. However, being aware of our emotions and understanding how they affect our behavior is a crucial tool in leadership. It allows us to regulate our opinions, judgments, and attention, leading to better decision-making and overall success. Written by Chester Davis John F Kennedy/Martin Luther King Jr. Barack Obama/Robert F Kennedy Barack Obama President John F Kennedy Martin Luther King, Jr. Robert F. Prioritizing Family: A Lesson from Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis In a world often dazzled by titles and accolades, let's pause to reflect on the timeless wisdom of Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis. She once said, "I'll prioritize being a wife and mother before assuming the role of First Lady." These words carry profound insights that resonate deeply. üîç Why read on? Two compelling reasons await: **The Power of Prioritization**: Jacqueline's life teaches us the invaluable lesson of placing family at the forefront. Discover how this priority became the cornerstone of her remarkable legacy. **Balancing Act**: Balancing personal life and public responsibilities is a universal challenge. Explore how Jacqueline adeptly navigated this delicate equilibrium. Jacqueline's life was a tapestry woven with elegance, strength, and purpose. She recognized that being a loving wife and devoted mother was a significant role in itself. This realization shaped her approach to her role as First Lady, infusing it with authenticity and empathy. As we traverse our unique journeys, Jacqueline's example serves as a guiding light: ‚ú® **Cherish Every Moment**: Embrace and savor precious moments with loved ones; they compose the tapestry of a meaningful life. ‚ú® **Authenticity Matters**: Jacqueline's authenticity earned her respect and admiration. Be unapologetically yourself, even in the most high-profile roles. ‚ú® **A Legacy of Love**: Jacqueline's legacy isn't merely a historical account; it lives in the hearts of those she loved and who loved her. Now, take a moment to contemplate how you can prioritize what truly matters in your life, just as Jacqueline did. Share your thoughts below. Let's inspire one another to embrace these values that forge enduring legacies. üåπüìú #PrioritizeFamily #Inspiration #LegacyBuilding #Authenticity #LifeLessons #FamilyFirst #Leadership #Priorities #Inspiration #Legacy #Motivation #Management #Inspiration

We underestimate the power of recognising people‚Äôs personal contribution. Many of us are used to looking out for things that are going wrong. After all, if something's wrong, it needs to be fixed before it damages clinical productivity, or affects the bottom line. But do you actively look out for things that are going right? And how often do you show your appreciation for people who are performing well Join Black Country Healthcare where we see what you do, where we celebrate your work‚Ä¶. https://lnkd.in/ehie6w7Y
